conclusion: Analyzing the current balance and forces involved to solve for magnetic induction intensity B

Description of the setup: current balance with rectangular coil, coil in uniform magnetic field, B field perpendicular to coil's plane, balance adjusted to equilibrium when current I passes, mass m added when current is reversed
Current-carrying wire in magnetic field experiences force; for straight segment: F = I × L × B
For rectangular coil with n turns, only horizontal segments of length L experience forces
Calculate force for initial current direction: F₁ = I × L × B for each segment, total force for n turns = 2 × n × I × L × B
Calculate force when current is reversed: F₂ = -I × L × B for each segment, total force = -2 × n × I × L × B
Find difference in forces: ΔF = F₁ - F₂ = 4 × n × I × L × B
Relate force difference to added mass: ΔF = m × g, 4 × n × I × L × B = m × g
Solve for B: B = (m × g) / (4 × n × I × L)
Final answer: magnitude of magnetic induction intensity B is B = (m × g) / (4 × n × I × L)
